description: Evaluates architecture designs for scalability, fault tolerance, security, compliance, and identifies potential issues with mitigation strategies

strengths: Supports horizontal scaling of stateless application servers
Load balancer evenly distributes incoming requests
concerns: Database is a single-instance deployment, limits vertical scalability
Potential bottleneck at message queue during peak workload
recommendations: Implement a clustered or managed database service with read replicas
Scale message queue infrastructure horizontally and enable partitioning

gaps: Single point of failure in the database layer
No automated failover configured for critical services
recommendations: Deploy a database cluster with automatic failover
Use multi-zone deployment for all stateful services
Implement circuit breakers in application logic

vulnerabilities: Data at rest encryption not enforced for files and databases
recommendations: Enable and mandate encryption at rest on all storage and databases
Implement centralized logging and monitoring for authentication and authorization events

gaps: No formal data retention or deletion policy for user data
recommendations: Define and implement data retention/deletion workflows
Establish robust RBAC controls and audit trails

performance_evaluation.expected_latency: 100-200ms per API request under moderate load
recommendations: Tune database connection pooling and indexing
Implement cache layer (e.g., Redis) for frequently accessed data

optimization_opportunities: Leverage reserved instances or committed use discounts for databases

potential_issues.impact: Total application downtime and data loss risk
Possible data breach and regulatory penalties

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Implement managed database cluster with automated failover
mitigation_strategies.implementation: Migrate to cloud SQL clusters (e.g., AWS RDS Multi-AZ, Google Cloud SQL High Availability)
mitigation_strategies.real_world_example: Netflix DBaaS infrastructure for streaming data

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Enforce encryption policies on all data stores
mitigation_strategies.implementation: Enable KMS-based encryption for databases and block storage volumes
mitigation_strategies.real_world_example: Airbnb's usage of AWS KMS for data protection

followed: TLS enforced for data in transit
missing: Comprehensive audit logging and retention management
